channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4485] How to piss off a hipster (PIC)
[+3229] Been tricked by this asshole since I was 8 years old (pic)
[+2110] Warren Buffet pledges 99% of his wealth to charity
item.description: In 2006, I made a commitment to gradually give all of my Berkshire Hathaway stock to philanthropic foundations. I couldn't be happier with that decision. Now, Bill and Melinda Gates and I are asking hundreds of rich Americans to pledge at least 50% of their wealth to charity. So I think it is fitting that I reiterate my intentions.

item.title: [+1920] Paraguay’s Hottest Fan Has A Name; Larissa Riquelme (Pics)
item.description: Since making its rounds yesterday on digg (digg.com/d31U3Cb), the woman in question was spotted in the crowd during Monday's World Cup match. The picture of this bombshell fan and her conveniently placed cell phone has made its way onto computer screens around the world.

item.title: [+1788] How defensive can deers be? (video)
[+1421] FAAAIIILL,,, oh. Nice one. Totally meant to do it.
item.description: Sometimes, it's better to be lucky than good. If he had suffered a real skateboard fail, it would have been much tougher to face his friends. I mean, this isn't really a skateboard fail at all. Is a skateboard fail on a trick really a fail at all? If a tree falls in the woods and no one is around to hear it...

item.title: [+1290] Actual map of LOST island
item.description: If you ever wondered about it yourself.

item.title: [+997] GOP congressman apologizes to BP for '$20 billion shakedown'
item.description: We're sorry that the government is forcing you to set up a $20 billion fund to compensate victims for creating the worst environmental oil spill disaster in the history of the United States, one Republican congressman suggested Thursday. Texas Republican Joe Barton actually called the $20 billion trust fund a "slush fund" and a "shakedown."

item.title: [+859] So many 'Simpsons' episodes, but never noticed... (pic)
[+838] Battle Rages Over Australia's Internet Filter
item.description: The concept of government-backed web censorship is usually associated with nations where human rights and freedom of speech are routinely curtailed. But if Canberra's plans for a mandatory Internet filter go ahead, Australia may soon become the first Western democracy to join the ranks of Iran, China and a handful of other nations where .......

item.title: [+785] VIDEO: Palin: Why Hasn't Obama Called The Dutch For Help?!
item.description: Palin said Obama had really blown it by not reaching out to the Dutch since they proved themselves so good at building dykes and sluices and dams to reclaim land from the sea. Which when you think about it is pretty much the same thing has capping an oil gusher a mile underwater.

item.title: [+771] Peaks of Himalayas Shot from atop Mt. Everest. Awesome (pic)
[+683] GOP Senate Candidates Too Stupid & Crazy to Face the Press
item.description: It's no accident or coincidence that Republicans in Washington are trying to shield Senate candidates Rand Paul and Sharron Angle from the national, and even local, press.

item.title: [+620] Renting a White Guy in China
item.description: Recruiting fake businessmen is one way to create the image—particularly, the image of connection—that Chinese companies crave.

item.title: [+530] European flooding - The Big Picture
item.description: Over the past month, heavy rainfall from different storms across parts of Europe has caused massive amounts of flooding - some water moving slowly across river plains and farmland, some moving swiftly through cities and villages. Dozens have lost their lives, many thousands evacuated their homes, some repeatedly - Poland in particular is suffering

item.title: [+529] Houses With Amazing View
item.description: Many of us want to have a vacation home or place where we can forget & get away with the daily rush of our lives. And these houses, their perfect location amidst nature, with their beautiful view are the perfect place where one can feel at home away from the population & the skyscrapers of the cities. A perfect & magnificent place to relax.

item.title: [+516] 12 Worst Movie Accents of All Time (Videos)
item.description: It takes a lot of skill for an actor to master a foreign accent. But when they pull it off, like Heath Ledger did as a cowboy in Brokeback Mountain or Gwyneth Paltrow as a Brit in Sliding Doors, it's a huge success. When they fail, however, it can ruin the movie and their reputation. Some actors actually become famous for their botched dialects.
